class.name: Kutsuja

t.entry: one or more skills determined by your Idoli

t: spell attack rolls of your spellcasting tradition, determined by your Idoli
spell DCs of your spellcasting tradition, determined by your Idoli

classFeaturesIntro.name: Class Features
entries: You gain all of the following abilities as a Kutsuja. Abilities gained at higher levels than 1st level always list the level at which you gain them next to the features' names.

flavor: You can magically beckon a powerful being called an Idoli to your side, serving as the mortal conduit that anchors it to the world. Whether your Idoli is a friend, a servant, or even a personal god, your connection to it marks you as extraordinary, shaping the course of your life dramatically.

fluff.name: During combat Encounters...
entries: You and your Idoli fight together as one. You can rely on your Idoli for mundane challenges, saving your spells for when they're needed most.

fluff.name: During social encounters...
entries: Your powerful personality allows you to take the lead when negotiating. You and your Idoli might engage with others in different ways, but even if your guardian remains silent, its presence reminds those around you of your power.

fluff.name: While exploring...
entries: Whether you remain on alert for the presence of strange magic or keep an eye out for trouble, you and your Idoli act together to cover more ground, pool your knowledge, and leverage each other's abilities.

fluff.name: In downtime...
entries: You might attempt to learn more about the nature of your Idoli and delve deeper into the secrets of its magical tradition to {@action Learn a Spell}, {@action Craft} magic items with your Idoli's help, or make allies using your social skills.

items: Rely on your Idoli to accomplish physical tasks while you handle the mental ones.
Develop attitudes and mannerisms in line with your Idoli's way of thinking, even as your nature shapes its behavior.
Consider your Idoli a close friend, a guiding figure, a protector, or a rival bound to you.
Feel safe with you (and your Idoli) at their side.
Expect that since you know information about your Idoli, you might know details about other sorts of strange monsters.
View you with awe or fear because of the powerful, strange creature that accompanies you.

summary.text: A Kutsuja acts as the living anchor to a powerful being called an Idoli, which they call upon for aid. Summoners maintain deep connections with their eidolons, granting them the ability to influence the way the creature evolves. Eidolons manifest in many forms, including as constructs, demons, dragons, Keijukainen, and other creatures.

sampleBuilds.name: Angelic Vessel
entries: Your Idoli is a being from the angelic hosts.
abilities: Improve your Charisma first, then Constitution, Dexterity, and Wisdom.

sampleBuilds.name: God Caller
entries: Your Idoli is a god born of the land's life force.
abilities: Focus on Charisma, Constitution, and then Strength.

classFeature.name: Ancestry and Background
entries: In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background.

classFeature.name: Initial Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

classFeature.name: Idoli
entries: You have a connection with a powerful and usually otherworldly entity called an Idoli, and you can use your life force as a conduit to manifest this ephemeral entity into the mortal world. Magic also flows through this conduit from your Idoli into you, so your Idoli determines the type of spells you cast and the spell list you choose from (as described in {@classFeature Kutsuja Spellcasting|Kutsuja|SoM|1}).

Choose a type of {@filter Idoli|companionsfamiliars||Type=Idoli} you have access to. When you choose your Idoli, you also determine its appearance and general form, within the parameters for that particular type of Idoli. Once you establish your Idoli's type and general appearance, these features can't be changed later, except by selecting special evolution feats that can cause your Idoli to develop new features.

Your magical connection with your Idoli takes the form of a sigil on each of your bodies. As long as your Idoli is manifested, the sigil glows with light and can't be covered or disguised via any means; it will shine through clothing, appear over cloaks, and remain unaffected by obfuscating magic. This, combined with the way that the two of you clearly act in tandem, makes it readily apparent to an intelligent observer that the two of you are connected in some way, even if the person has never encountered a Kutsuja before.
You bring your Idoli into reality with the {@action Manifest Idoli|SoM} action.

Your Idoli is no mere minion. It doesn't have the {@trait minion} or {@trait summoned} trait, and the two of you work together and coordinate your actions. You and your Idoli share your actions and multiple attack penalty. Each round, you can use any of your actions (including reactions and free actions) for yourself or your Idoli.
You coordinate your actions with your Idoli more efficiently when you {@action Act Together|SoM}.
Your connection with your Idoli allows you to communicate with it telepathically at all times, even when it isn't manifested. You also gain the {@action Share Senses} action.

Lastly, the connection between you and your Idoli means you both share a single pool of Hit Points. Damage taken by either you or the Idoli reduces your Hit Points, while healing either of you recovers your Hit Points. Like with your actions, if you and your Idoli are both subject to the same effect that affects your Hit Points, you apply those effects only once (applying the greater effect, if applicable). For instance, if you and your Idoli get caught in an area effect that would heal or damage you both, only the greater amount of healing or damage applies.

entries.name: Gear and your Idoli
entries: Your Idoli can't wear or use magic items, except for items with the {@trait Idoli} trait. An Idoli can have up to two items invested. Your Idoli's link to you means it can benefit from certain magic items invested by you.

items: Your Idoli gains item bonuses to {@skill Perception} and skills from any magical items that you have invested.

Your Idoli increases its item bonus to AC based on your armor's armor potency rune or bracers of armor. It also gains an item bonus to its saves from the resilient rune on your armor or from your bracers of armor. Other permanent items that grant or increase item bonuses to AC and saves might convey a similar benefit, as determined by the GM.

Your Idoli's {@action Strike||Strikes} benefit from the fundamental and property runes on your {@item handwraps of mighty blows (generic)|CRB|handwraps of mighty blows}. Alternatively, you can {@action Invest an Item||Invest} a magic weapon (even though magic weapons can't normally be Invested) to share its fundamental and property runes with your Idoli. You share these benefits only while you're holding the weapon, and you can have no more than one weapon invested in this way at a time. In either case, the Idoli gains only the benefits that can apply to its attacks, with the same limitations noted in {@item handwraps of mighty blows (generic)|CRB|handwraps of mighty blows}.

entries.name: Lost and Altered Actions
entries: If you or your Idoli becomes {@condition slowed}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition quickened}, or otherwise affected by something that changes the actions you gain at the start of each turn, it affects your shared actions. However, if you are both subject to such an effect, apply only the more severe one. For instance, if you or your Idoli were {@condition slowed 1}, you would start your turn with one fewer action, but if you were both {@condition slowed 1}, you would still lose only one action, rather than adding the two slowed effects together. However, if you were {@condition slowed 1} and your Idoli {@condition slowed 2}, you'd have two fewer actions, because that's the more severe effect. If only one of you becomes restricted in how you can spend your actions, that restriction doesn't automatically extend to the other; for example, if your Idoli became {@condition immobilized} or {@condition petrified}, it wouldn't be able to move, but you could still use your actions to move. The GM resolves any situation that's unclear.

You, as the player, control both your Kutsuja and your Idoli, and the two are generally considered to cooperate unless you decide for them not to. While a Kutsuja's link with an Idoli is a partnership, ultimately the Idoli is linked to you, not the other way around. If there's ever a conflict of who should act, you win out over your Idoli. This means that if the Idoli comes under an effect that would take its actions out of your control, such as the {@condition confused} or {@condition controlled} condition, you can use all of your shared actions so your Idoli doesn't have any actions remaining to cause trouble (as long as you are able to act). However, if you came under such an effect, you would simply use all of your shared actions, preventing your Idoli from acting.

classFeature.name: Kutsuja Spellcasting
entries: Your link to your Idoli grants you limited magic connected to your Idoli's nature. You can cast spells using the {@action Cast a Spell} activity, and you can supply material, somatic, and verbal components when casting spells. Because of the magic you draw from your Idoli, you can usually replace material components with somatic components, so you don't need a material component pouch.

Each day, you can cast one 1st-level spell and five cantrips. You must know spells to cast them, and you learn them via the spell repertoire class feature. The number of spells you can cast each day is called your spell slots.

As you increase in level as a Kutsuja, the magical link with your Idoli grants you additional, more powerful spell slots. Your total number of spell slots and the highest level of spells you can cast are shown in Table 2–4: Kutsuja Spells per Day. Because of the way you draw magic from your connection to your Idoli, you begin to lose lower-level spell slots once you reach 5th level. The maximum number of spell slots you get from the Kutsuja class is four, starting when you reach 4th level.

Some of your spells require you to attempt a spell attack roll to see how effective they are, or have your enemies roll against your spell DC (typically by attempting a saving throw). Since your key ability is Charisma, your spell attack rolls and spell DCs use your Charisma modifier. Details on calculating these statistics appear on page 447 of the Core Rulebook.

entries.name: Heightening Spells
entries: When you gain spell slots of 2nd level and higher, you can fill those slots with stronger versions of lower-level spells. This increases the spell's level, heightening it to match the spell slot. Many spells have specific improvements when they are heightened to certain levels.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: A cantrip is a special type of spell that doesn't use spell slots. You can cast a cantrip at will, any number of times per day. A cantrip is always automatically heightened to half your level rounded up—this is usually equal to the highest level of spell you can cast as a Kutsuja. For example, as a 1st-level Kutsuja, your cantrips are 1st-level spells, and as a 5th-level Kutsuja, your cantrips are 3rd-level spells.

classFeature.name: Spell Repertoire
entries: The collection of spells you can cast is called your spell repertoire. At 1st level, you learn two {@filter 1st-level spells|spells||spell type=spell|rarity=common|level=1} of your choice and five {@filter cantrips|spells||spell type=cantrip|rarity=common} of your choice. You choose these from the common spells from the tradition corresponding to your Idoli, or from other spells from that tradition to which you have access. You can cast any spell in your spell repertoire by using a spell slot of an appropriate spell level. Your spell slots and the spells in your spell repertoire are separate. If a feat or other ability adds a spell to your spell repertoire, it doesn't give you another spell slot, and vice versa.

You add to this spell repertoire as you increase in level. Each time you get a spell slot (see Table 2–4: Kutsuja Spells per Day), you add a spell of the same level to your spell repertoire. At 2nd level, you select another 1st-level spell. At 3rd level, you add the first 2nd-level spell to your repertoire. At 4th level you gain your second and your spell repertoire reaches its maximum size of five spells.

At 5th level, in addition to adding two 3rd-level spells to your repertoire, you lose your lowest level of spell slots. Any time you lose a level of spell slots, you lose two spells in your repertoire as well. These can come from spells you already know or out of the number of new spells you're learning. On levels in which you don't change your spell slots, you can swap out multiple spells, as described below.

entries.name: Swapping Spells in Your Repertoire
entries: As you gain new spells in your repertoire, you might want to replace some of the spells you previously learned. Each time you gain a level and learn new spells, you can swap out one of your old spells for a different spell of the same level. If it's a level at which you lose a set of lower-level slots, you can replace the two in either order. You can also instead swap a cantrip. You can also swap out spells by retraining during downtime.

At 6th level and every even level thereafter, you can swap out any number of your spells for different spells of a level you can cast. When you do, you must keep at least one spell you can cast with your lowest level of spell slots so you don't end up with slots you can't use. For instance, at 6th level you would need to keep at least one 2nd-level spell, but all your other spells could be 3rd level.

classFeature.name: Link Spells
entries: Your connection to your Idoli allows you to cast link spells, special spells that have been forged through your shared connection with your Idoli. Link spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the {@action Refocus} activity to specifically connect with your Idoli, such as by having a heart-to-heart conversation, playing together, or meditating in unison on the nature of your bond.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and you can't cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 Focus Points. The full rules for focus spells appear on page 300 of the Core Rulebook.
You learn the {@spell evolution surge|SoM} link spell, which allows you to grant your Idoli one of several useful benefits.

entries.name: Link Cantrips
entries: Link cantrips are special link spells that don't cost Focus Points, so you can cast them as often as you like. Link cantrips are in addition to the cantrips you choose from your tradition's spell list. Generally, only feats can give you more link cantrips. Unlike other cantrips, you can't swap out link cantrips gained from Kutsuja feats at a later level, unless you swap out the specific feat via {@action retraining}.
You learn the {@spell boost Idoli|SoM} link cantrip, which briefly improves your Idoli's capabilities, allowing it to attack with greater power.

classFeature.name: Evolution Feat
entries: {@trait Evolution} feats are a special type of Kutsuja class feat that allow you to customize your Idoli through your shared link. You gain an {@filter evolution feat|feats||general=evolution|level=[1;1]} for your Idoli at 1st level, representing the differences that make it unique from other eidolons of its type. If you retrain this feat, the feat you replace it with must also be an {@filter evolution feat|feats||general=evolution|level=[1;1]}.

classFeature.name: Skill Feats
entries: At 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter skill feat|feats||type=skill;!archetype|level=[1;2]}. You must be trained or better in the corresponding skill to select a skill feat.

classFeature.name: Kutsuja Feats
entries: At 2nd level and every even-numbered level thereafter, you gain a {@filter Kutsuja class feat|feats||type=class|Class=Kutsuja|level=[1;2]}.

classFeature.name: General Feats
entries: At 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter general feat|feats||type=general|level=[1;3]}.

classFeature.name: Shared Vigilance
entries: You and your Idoli work together to remain alert to threats around you, allowing you to perceive far more together than you could individually. Your proficiency rank in Perception and your Idoli's proficiency rank in Perception increase to expert.

classFeature.name: Skill Increases
entries: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you're untrained in, or to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you're already trained to expert.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you're already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to increase your proficiency rank to legendary in a skill in which you're already a master.

classFeature.name: Unlimited Signature Spells
entries: All of your spells are signature spells. That means that if you know a spell, you can heighten it freely by casting it from a higher-level spell slot, up to the maximum level of spell you can cast. You can similarly cast any of its lower-level versions without learning them separately.

classFeature.name: Ability Boosts
entries: At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you boost four different ability scores. You can use these ability boosts to increase your ability scores above 18. Boosting an ability score increases it by 1 if the ability score is already 18 or above, or by 2 if it starts out below 18.
Your Idoli also gets four ability boosts at these levels. The Idoli's ability boosts follow the same rules as yours.

classFeature.name: Ancestry Feats
entries: In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an {@filter ancestry feat|feats||type=ancestry|level=[1;5]} at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

classFeature.name: Idoli Unarmed Expertise
entries: Your Idoli becomes more capable of using its unarmed attacks. Its proficiency rank for unarmed attacks increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Idoli Symbiosis
entries: Your connection with your Idoli strengthens, granting your Idoli access to a new ability depending on its type, as described in Idoli Abilities in each Idoli's entry.

classFeature.name: Idoli Weapon Specialization
entries: Your Idoli has learned how to inflict greater injuries with its unarmed attacks. It deals 2 additional damage with unarmed attacks in which it's an expert. This damage increases to 3 if it's a master, and 4 if it's legendary.

classFeature.name: Expert Spellcaster
entries: As your connection to your Idoli deepens, the power of your spells increases. Your proficiency ranks for spell attack rolls and spell DCs for spells of your Idoli's tradition increase to expert.

classFeature.name: Shared Reflexes
entries: You and your Idoli boost each other's reflexes, allowing you both to roll away from danger. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves and your Idoli's proficiency rank for Reflex saves increase to expert.

classFeature.name: Idoli Defensive Expertise
entries: Your Idoli increases its ability to avoid attacks. Its proficiency rank for unarmored defense increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Simple Weapon Expertise
entries: Training and magic improved your weapon technique. Your proficiency rank for simple weapons and unarmed attacks increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Twin Juggernauts
entries: You and your Idoli fight off physical hardship together with your shared life force. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves and your Idoli's proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increase to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead. When your Idoli rolls a success on a Fortitude save, it gets a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Defensive Robes
entries: The flow of magic around you increases your ability to avoid attacks. Your proficiency rank in unarmored defense increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Idoli Unarmed Mastery
entries: Your Idoli truly masters its unarmed attacks, reaching greater heights. Its proficiency rank for unarmed attacks increases to master.

classFeature.name: Weapon Specialization
entries: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master, and 4 if you're legendary

classFeature.name: Greater Idoli Specialization
entries: Your Idoli's damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with unarmed attacks in which it's an expert, 6 if it's a master, and 8 if it's legendary

classFeature.name: Shared Resolve
entries: You and your Idoli steel your mind together against effects that threaten you, each protecting the others' minds from danger. Your and your Idoli's proficiency ranks for Will saves increase to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead. When your Idoli rolls a success on a Will save, it gets a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Idoli Transcendence
entries: Your connection with your Idoli approaches its peak, granting your Idoli access to a powerful new ability depending on its type, as described in Idoli Abilities in each Idoli's entry. This ability also increases one of the Idoli's ability scores by 2.

classFeature.name: Master Spellcaster
entries: Your connection to your Idoli is strong enough to grant you mastery over associated spells. Your proficiency ranks for spell attack rolls and spell DCs for spells of your Idoli's tradition increase to master.

classFeature.name: Idoli Defensive Mastery
entries: Your Idoli's form becomes particularly difficult to assail. Its proficiency rank for unarmored defense increases to master.

classFeature.name: Instant Manifestation
entries: You can manifest your Idoli with incredible speed. You can use {@action Manifest Idoli|SoM} as a single action, instead of a three-action activity.

entries.name: Enkeli
entries: Your Idoli is a celestial messenger, a member of the angelic host with a unique link to you, allowing them to carry a special message to the mortal world at your side. Most Enkeli eidolons are roughly humanoid in form, with feathered wings, glowing eyes, halos, or similar angelic features. However, some take the form of smaller angelic servitors like the winged helmet cassisian Enkeli instead. The two of you are destined for an important role in the plans of the celestial realms. Though a true Enkeli, your Enkeli Idoli's link to you as a mortal prevents them from casting the {@ritual angelic messenger|b1} ritual, even if they somehow learn it.

entries.name: Vitutus haamu Idoli
entries: Your Idoli is a lost soul, bound to the mortal world by undying anger or a bitter grudge. Most phantom eidolons are humanoids with a spectral or ectoplasmic appearance, though some take far stranger forms. Your link with your Idoli prevents it from succumbing to corruption and undeath. Together, you will need to decide whether to work with your Idoli to control its anger, or channel its wrath into power.

entries.name: Peto Idoli
entries: Your Idoli is a manifestation of the life force of nature in the form of a powerful magical Peto that often has animal features, possibly even several from different species. You might have learned the way to connect with the world's life force via a specific philosophy or practice, such as the beliefs of the god callers of Sarkoris, or formed a bond on your own. Regardless, your link to your Idoli allows you both to grow in power and influence to keep your home safe from those who would despoil it.

entries.name: Rakennelma
entries: Your Idoli is a mental Rakennelma based on an astral thoughtform and given physical presence and life by its connection to you, its shape limited only by your imagination. Your Idoli's appearance and physical form vary based on your shared vision for its construction, from clockworks to stuffed dolls and everything between, and it's not uncommon for that appearance to change greatly as your Rakennelma gains evolutions. Because it arises from an astral entity, your Rakennelma is no mindless servitor, but a fully thinking being with its own ideas, goals, and even emotions. These entities are extremely diverse; while many Rakennelma eidolons come from a powerful symbiotic connection with astral denizens, just as many arise from the forgotten memories of ancient empires and craftworks drifting across the Silver Sea of the Astral Plane.

entries.name: Eidolons and Epäkuollut
entries: An Idoli and Kutsuja link together via life force, which Epäkuollut lack. Epäkuollut spirits often have an easier time manifesting on their own than sharing a link with a living creature. Dhampirs and other creatures with {@ability negative healing|b2} have a much easier time bonding with an Epäkuollut as an Idoli. It might be more uncomfortable and unlikely, but an Epäkuollut Idoli can bond with any living creature, and the connection to the living grants them unparalleled freedom from the cravings and weaknesses of undeath.

entries.name: Epäkuollut
entries: Your Idoli is an Epäkuollut spirit pulled from the {@place Ethereal Plane} or {@place Negative Energy Plane}, embodied, and bound to your life force in an unusual, potentially antithetical way that even other summoners can't quite understand. Epäkuollut eidolons take about every imaginable shape and form, as their bodies manifest from their connection to you. Their ultimate form can be influenced by an amalgamation of the echoes and memories of their old life before becoming Epäkuollut, their cause of death, their encounters in the afterlife, and portions of your own essences. Together, you and your Idoli need to explore the mysteries of life, death, and undeath to understand what your bond means for both of your futures.

entries.name: Paholainen
Embodiments of Sin
entries: While all Paholainen eidolons have an associated sin, those sins can be incredibly varied. While many Paholainen summoners conjure up easily recognizable eidolons, such as tempter demons appearing in the form of seductive succubi or wrecker demons taking on the form of destructive abrikandilus, other demons may also answer the call, including ones no one has ever seen before on the Material Plane. A greed-filled Kutsuja might find that their Idoli is in truth one of the fearsome boar demons known as a nalfeshnee, while a Kutsuja whose secret sins are stranger and darker than the average person might ever contemplate could conjure up a demonic presence whose appearance has never been recorded in the history of the mortal world.

Your Idoli is a Paholainen, born of mortal sin congealed amid the chaos and evil of the Abyss, using its link to you to spread chaos at your side. Choose an associated sin for your Paholainen. Paholainen eidolons have appearances as varied as the infinite Abyss. While demons are inherently untrustworthy, your Paholainen Idoli has reached an accord with you and generally keeps it, though that doesn't mean your Idoli isn't actively working to bring your life deeper into its associated sin. Though a true Paholainen, your Paholainen Idoli's link to you as a mortal prevents them from casting the {@ritual abyssal pact|b1} ritual, even if they somehow learn it.

entries.name: Autaumus haamu
entries: Your Idoli is a lost soul, unable to escape the mortal world due to a strong sense of duty, an undying devotion, or a need to complete an important task. Most phantom eidolons are humanoid with a spectral or ectoplasmic appearance, though some take far stranger forms. Your link with your Idoli prevents them from succumbing to corruption and undeath, and together, you will grow in strength and fulfill your phantom's devotion.

entries.name: Lohikäärme Idoli
entries: Because dragons have a strong connection to magic, their minds can often leave an echo floating in the Astral Plane. Such an entity is extremely powerful but unable to interact with the outside world on its own. Lohikäärme eidolons manifest in the powerful, scaled forms they had in life; most take the form of true dragons (albeit smaller), but some manifest as drakes or other draconic beings. You have forged a connection with such a Lohikäärme Idoli and together, you seek to grow as powerful as an ancient wyrm.

entries.name: Keijukainen Idoli
entries: Your Idoli is a Keijukainen, a capricious being of the mysterious First World. Many Keijukainen appear similar to mortal humanoids with unusual features such as pointed ears, wings, or bodies composed of natural elements, but the full variety of Keijukainen is endless, and many others appear completely inhuman. Keijukainen from the First World never truly die, instead forming a new creature. Keijukainen eidolons usually come about when a Kutsuja helps stabilize a difficult reformation. This means your Keijukainen Idoli likely lived a different life just before meeting you and might remember fragments of its old memories. Together, you might have to unravel a memory from your Idoli's past life among the Keijukainen.

entries.name: Kasvi Idoli
entries: Your Idoli is an intelligent Kasvi, formed from the same disembodied fragments of nature's life energy that become leshys. Kasvi eidolons tend to be curious and adaptable, with temperaments based on the parts of mortal culture they feel affinity toward. Despite coming from the same source, Kasvi eidolons don't always look like leshys. Kasvi eidolons have forms that vary greatly and can look like almost any kind of Kasvi creature in existence. Some even resemble Kasvi creatures so strange they are impossible to identify.

entries.name: Saattaja Idoli
entries: Your Idoli is a Saattaja, a creature whose sworn duty is to usher souls safely to the afterlife and maintain the courts of the dead. Saattaja eidolons have a variety of appearances, but since they often traffic with mortals, their form typically includes an elaborate mask. You and your Saattaja Idoli share an important fate together, whether it relates directly to your own soul or to a mission that will somehow protect the souls of others.
